title: On Location: Photographing Architect Cesar Pelli
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley travels to New Haven, Connecticut, to photograph renowned architect Cesar Pelli. The video details the gear used, the lighting strategy for balancing the subject with a background of architectural models, and the actual photoshoot process.

steps.action: Review the equipment list while traveling, mentioning Kinos, Profoto, AlienBees, and Phottix Softlighters.
Arrive at the location in New Haven and unload the gear.
Analyze the scene to mix lights, ensuring the subject's face is balanced with the background wall art and models.
Place a 2-foot Kino Flo light in the background to shine through the architectural models.
Set up a second Kino Flo in the front to illuminate the foreground models.
Position the main light source to illuminate the subject.
Shoot the portrait while directing the subject on head tilts and posture.

key_takeaways: Balance artificial light with the environment to ensure background details remain visible.
Use backlighting behind translucent or complex objects to add depth to the scene.
Active direction of the subject's pose is essential for a successful portrait.
